intro: Ipomopsis thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's touching grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Ipomopsis thurberi is often found in open woodlands and along canyon walls, where it thrives in full sun.
